TopicTitle: You must use the object that is in your left hand to survive a thermonuclear war

Articles.Content: my shirt.... well I'm dead
My radiation proof corgi skin. And of course some regenerating food and water in a bag in my left hand
my french homework... I hate my life...
Nothing. Can I turn other things into nothing?
A potato chip. Well, il last longer then brian....

My face... I think I whould've had that even if I didn't touch it so I wasted my last chance, damn.

>Starwhip

You might be able to launch small bursts of nothing to annihilate stuff... You know, like magic
My friend in math class. Good, I have a human shield
Face again... whatever.

My iPhone.

Where's the outlet in this bunker?
...why do I keep touching my face when I get on this thread....

A strange Pinkie toy...

I don't even know where it come from...
A wooden cabinet. I'll hide inside till the wars over.

A macadamia nut

At least I can eat something...
a table... well now I can a sleep on it?
A Fridge, i can hide in there and come out when the wars over

A box of school furnitures...

Great!

My chair... I feel like throwing that into someone's face and if we're all gonna die it whouldn't really matter... Though it's somewhat pathetic to die throwing stuff at people for no reason. I can think of more emotional ways to spend my last minutes/hours, you know, those who make the people on the safe side of the 4th wall cry... YES I MEAN YOU IDIOTIC WATCHER!
...my arm.. ah I think I would have that anyway so....
I'm just sitting here, watching the termonuclear war, with a arduino uno...
A bag of chips. Well, I guess I'll be the first one to die.
Does anyone want a keyboard? I'd take a bunker in exchange...
gots a pen if it helps any
I use my mighty beard as a shelter!

An iPad.

Apple map will surely help me.
a computer hm i guess i better start learning how to hack in to a ICBM
